plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flower heads known for turning to face the sun. Widely cultivated for its seeds and ornamental value.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, native to North America
plants.funFact: Sunflowers follow the sun across the sky during their bud stage, a behavior called heliotropism.

plants.name: Lilium lancifolium
plants.description: A robust perennial lily with striking orange flowers spotted with dark markings. Grows well in temperate climates.
plants.location: Native to East Asia, widely cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Tiger lilies are unique among lilies because their bulbs produce small bulblets used for propagation.

plants.name: Banksia spinulosa
plants.description: An Australian native shrub or small tree, featuring cylindrical flower spikes with numerous bright yellow to orange flowers that attract birds and insects.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late winter to early spring in native range but some varieties bloom sporadically including late summer
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers produce a nectar that's a food source for many birds and mammals in Australia.

plants.name: Tithonia rotundifolia
plants.description: A fast-growing annual with bright orange to red daisy-like flowers known for attracting butterflies and hummingbirds.
plants.location: Native to Mexico and Central America, widely grown in warm climates
plants.funFact: Mexican Sunflowers are often used in gardens to attract pollinators like butterflies and hummingbirds.
